summary: Temple of the Dog was an American rock band formed in 1990 in Seattle. Chris Cornell, the lead singer of Soundgarden, created the band as a tribute to his friend Andrew Wood. The band included future members of Pearl Jam, like Stone Gossard, Jeff Ament, Mike McCready, and Matt Cameron. Eddie Vedder, Pearl Jam's lead singer, also contributed. Their only album, "Temple of the Dog," was released in 1991 but gained popularity later. The band reunited for a tour in 2016 to celebrate the album's 25th anniversary.
title: Temple of the Dog
